name: 3.5.2. Transitive Planes
content:

@Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.ryIRK7CjUk9fI8TT]{3.5. The Planes}

  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.Q71BilaWEOeIsfux]{3.5.1. Material Plane}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.PWWyAj9RxKmCOZjr]{3.5.2. Transitive Planes}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.9ZxtJSapPINNjxbT]{3.5.3. Inner Planes}

  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.XC9n0Ynwpq8C9Sm9]{3.5.5. Demiplanes}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.ngl3E9mNPsbToy2u]{3.5.6. Layered Planes}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.5HeGmOWABLZ7bME7]{3.5.7. How Planes Interact}

Transitive planes have one important common characteristic: they “overlap” with other planes, and as such can be used to travel between these overlapping realities. These planes have the strongest regular interaction with the Material Plane and are often accessed by using various spells. They have native inhabitants as well.

Example transitive planes include the following.

  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.wIOKevEcdi1td8qE]{3.5.2.1. Astral Plane}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.DbV0r2IXhYsQM3yd]{3.5.2.2. Etheral Plane}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.6Al8NK1Ns6hjr5AL]{3.5.2.3. Shadow Plane}
